title: Nominations Sent to the Senate for United States Director of the African Development Bank and Federal Labor Relations Authority General Counsel
summary: The White House issued a notice titled Nominations Sent to the Senate announcing nominations to the United States Senate. The announcements include Ademola Adewale-Sadik, of New York, nominated to be United States Director of the African Development Bank for a five-year term, succeeding Oren E. Whyche-Shaw; Charlton Allen, of North Carolina, nominated to be General Counsel of the Federal Labor Relations Authority for a five-year term, succeeding Julia Akins Clark; and Matthew Anderson, of [location not specified in the excerpt], nominated for another position with details not provided in the excerpt. The nominations are part of presidential actions posted by The White House.

title: Executive Order to Withdraw the United States from International Organizations, Conventions, and Treaties Contrary to the Interests of the United States
summary: Directs the heads of executive departments and agencies to withdraw the United States from specified international organizations, conventions, and treaties that are deemed contrary to United States interests, and to terminate funding associated with those memberships or agreements. References Executive Order 14199, issued on February 4, 2025, which established withdrawal from and ending funding to certain international engagements, and assigns responsibility to relevant department and agency heads to implement the withdrawal actions.

title: Executive Order on Prioritizing Warfighter Needs in Defense Contracting
summary: This executive action directs federal agencies to place the needs and requirements of the military warfighter at the center of defense contracting. It aims to enhance U.S. military readiness by prioritizing essential capabilities in procurement, establishing criteria for evaluating contractor performance, and aligning contracting practices with national defense objectives. The order calls for policy and process adjustments to improve oversight and accountability for defense contracts, strengthen supply chain resilience, and ensure that resources and timelines support the timely delivery of critical defense capabilities.

title: Nominations Sent to the Senate: Andrew Benson for U.S. Attorney for the District of Maine; Megan Blair Benton for U.S. District Judge for the Western District of Missouri; and William Boyle for a United States position
summary: The White House notice lists nominations sent to the Senate, including Andrew Benson of Maine to be United States Attorney for the District of Maine for a four-year term, replacing Darcie N. McElwee; Megan Blair Benton of Missouri to be United States District Judge for the Western District of Missouri, to succeed M. Douglas Harpool upon retirement; and William Boyle of North Carolina to be a United States appointment, with the position and details not specified in the provided excerpt.

title: Presidential Proclamation on Amendments to Adjusting Imports of Timber, Lumber, and Their Derivative Products into the United States under Section 232
summary: This presidential proclamation discusses the use of authorities under section 232 of the Trade Expansion Act to address the national security implications of imports of timber, lumber, and their derivative products. It notes that on July 1, 2025 the Secretary of Commerce transmitted to the President a report evaluating the effects of these imports on U.S. national security. The proclamation references amendments titled Amending Adjustments to Imports of Timber, Lumber, and Their Derivative Products into the United States and states that these amendments are to be implemented as described in the linked action from the White House.

title: Presidential Action Implementing United States-Israel Agreement on Trade in Agricultural Products and Related Provisions
summary: This White House presidential action implements the United States-Israel Agreement on Trade in Agricultural Products as part of the United States-Israel Free Trade Area established in 1985. The action describes measures undertaken to carry out the agreement's provisions governing trade in agricultural products and related purposes, exercising authority provided by the United Statesâ€“Israel Free Trade Area Implementation Act. It references the statutory framework and outlines the scope of regulatory adjustments and administrative steps required to fulfill the bilateral commitments between the United States and Israel.

title: Executive Order Adjusting Rates of Basic Pay for Statutory Federal Pay Systems
summary: This executive order sets adjustments to the rates of basic pay or salaries for statutory pay systems, as defined in 5 U.S.C. 5302(1), with the adjustments authorized under 5 U.S.C. 5303. It establishes the updated pay rates for federal employees covered by statutory pay systems and describes the statutory authorities and scope that govern these adjustments.
